intro: Hieracium schmidtii subsp. cenomanicum, commonly known as the Cenomanian hawkweed, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in calcareous grasslands and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is distinguished by its finely divided leaves and the presence of glandular hairs on its foliage. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
